name: Carbon
applications: Organic chemistry (basis of all organic compounds)

reactions.name: Photosynthesis (overall)
reactions.conditions: chlorophyll; light energy (sunlight); thylakoid membranes
reactions.description: Converts light energy to chemical energy. Produces all atmospheric O2. Calvin cycle fixes CO2.

reactions.name: Cellular respiration (overall)
reactions.conditions: glycolysis + Krebs cycle + oxidative phosphorylation; ~30-32 ATP per glucose
reactions.description: Complete oxidation of glucose. Exact reverse of photosynthesis. Powers all aerobic life.

reactions.name: Glycolysis (net reaction)
reactions.equation: C6H12O6(s) + 2 NAD+(aq) + 2 ADP(aq) + 2 Pi(aq) -> 2 CH3COCOO-(aq) + 2 NADH(aq) + 2 ATP(aq) + 2 H2O(l)
reactions.conditions: cytoplasm; 10 enzyme-catalyzed steps
reactions.description: Glucose to 2 pyruvate. Net 2 ATP + 2 NADH. Universal pathway in all domains of life.

reactions.name: Ethanol fermentation
reactions.conditions: zymase (yeast enzymes); anaerobic conditions; Saccharomyces cerevisiae
reactions.description: Anaerobic glucose metabolism by yeast. Produces beer, wine, bread (CO2 leavening).

reactions.name: Lactic acid fermentation
reactions.conditions: lactate dehydrogenase; anaerobic; muscle cells during intense exercise
reactions.description: Anaerobic pathway in muscle. Also used by Lactobacillus in yogurt/sauerkraut production.

reactions.name: Krebs cycle (overall per acetyl-CoA)
reactions.equation: Acetyl-CoA + 3 NAD+ + FAD + GDP + Pi + 2 H2O -> CoA-SH + 2 CO2 + 3 NADH + FADH2 + GTP
reactions.conditions: mitochondrial matrix; 8 enzyme-catalyzed steps; regulated by [ATP]/[ADP]
reactions.description: Central metabolic hub. Oxidizes acetyl groups to CO2, generating electron carriers for ETC.

reactions.name: Beta-oxidation of fatty acids (per cycle)
reactions.equation: Acyl-CoA(Cn) + FAD + NAD+ + CoA-SH + H2O -> Acyl-CoA(Cn-2) + FADH2 + NADH + Acetyl-CoA
reactions.conditions: mitochondrial matrix; 4 enzymes per cycle; each cycle removes 2 carbons
reactions.description: Fatty acid catabolism. Each cycle yields 1 FADH2, 1 NADH, 1 acetyl-CoA (~14 ATP per cycle).

reactions.name: Hemoglobin oxygen binding
reactions.conditions: cooperative binding (sigmoidal curve); Fe2+ in heme porphyrin; P50 = 26 mmHg
reactions.description: Cooperative O2 binding to hemoglobin's four heme groups. Fe2+ does NOT oxidize to Fe3+.

reactions.name: Chlorophyll light absorption
reactions.conditions: absorbs red (680 nm) and blue (430 nm); Mg2+ coordinated by porphyrin ring
reactions.description: Chlorophyll absorbs light via Mg-porphyrin chromophore. Excited electron enters photosystem.

reactions.name: Urease catalysis
reactions.conditions: urease (Ni2+ active site); rate enhancement: 10^14 over uncatalyzed
reactions.description: Urease was the first enzyme crystallized (Sumner, 1926). Contains dinuclear Ni center.

reactions.name: ATP hydrolysis
reactions.conditions: Mg2+ cofactor; standard biochemical conditions (pH 7, 1mM)
reactions.description: Universal energy currency of life. Drives endergonic reactions by coupling. ~100 kg ATP recycled/day in humans.

reactions.name: ATP synthesis (oxidative phosphorylation)
reactions.conditions: ATP synthase (Complex V); proton motive force across inner mitochondrial membrane
reactions.description: Chemiosmotic synthesis of ATP. F1Fo-ATP synthase rotary motor. ~26-28 ATP from one glucose.

reactions.name: Disulfide bond formation (protein folding)
reactions.conditions: endoplasmic reticulum; protein disulfide isomerase (PDI)
reactions.description: Cysteine disulfide bridges stabilize protein tertiary structure. Oxidizing environment of ER.

reactions.name: Carbonic anhydrase
reactions.conditions: carbonic anhydrase (Zn2+ active site); kcat ~10^6 s-1; one of fastest enzymes
reactions.description: Zinc metalloenzyme. Catalyzes CO2 hydration ~10^6 times faster than uncatalyzed. Critical for CO2 transport and pH regulation.

reactions.name: Ocean acidification
reactions.conditions: oceans absorb ~30% of anthropogenic CO2; pH dropped from 8.2 to 8.1 since pre-industrial
reactions.description: CO2 dissolution lowers ocean pH. Threatens coral reefs and shellfish (CaCO3 dissolution).

reactions.name: Methanogenesis
reactions.conditions: methanogenic archaea; strictly anaerobic; wetlands, ruminant guts, landfills
reactions.description: Archaeal methanogenesis. Major biogenic CH4 source. Contributes to greenhouse effect.

reactions.name: Methane oxidation (atmospheric sink)
reactions.conditions: hydroxyl radical (OH*) initiated; tropospheric lifetime ~12 years
reactions.description: Atmospheric methane removal by OH radical. Primary sink for CH4 greenhouse gas.

reactions.name: Chemical weathering of limestone
reactions.conditions: rain dissolves atmospheric CO2 forming weak carbonic acid
reactions.description: Creates caves, karst topography. Major CO2 sink on geological timescale. Causes hard water.

reactions.name: Mercury methylation (bioaccumulation)
reactions.conditions: anaerobic sulfate-reducing bacteria; wetlands and sediments
reactions.description: Methylmercury bioaccumulates in food chains. Minamata disease. Extremely neurotoxic.

reactions.name: Sulfate reduction (deep ocean)
reactions.conditions: sulfate-reducing bacteria (Desulfovibrio); anaerobic marine sediments
reactions.description: Microbial sulfate reduction. Produces H2S (rotten egg smell). Forms black FeS in sediments.

reactions.name: Silicate weathering (CO2 sink)
reactions.equation: CaSiO3(s) + 2 CO2(g) + 3 H2O(l) -> Ca2+(aq) + 2 HCO3-(aq) + H4SiO4(aq)
reactions.conditions: geological timescale; thermostat of Earth's climate
reactions.description: Silicate weathering is the primary geological CO2 sink. Urey reaction controls climate over millions of years.

reactions.name: Hall-Heroult process
reactions.conditions: 1233 K; electrolysis in molten cryolite (Na3AlF6) bath; carbon anodes consumed
reactions.description: Primary aluminium smelting. Consumes ~15 kWh per kg Al. Dissolved in cryolite at ~960C.

reactions.name: Fischer-Tropsch synthesis (general)
reactions.equation: n CO(g) + (2n+1) H2(g) -> CnH(2n+2)(l) + n H2O(g)
reactions.conditions: 523 K; 25 atm; iron or cobalt
reactions.description: Converts syngas to liquid hydrocarbons. Used for gas-to-liquids (GTL) and coal-to-liquids.

reactions.name: Methanol synthesis
reactions.conditions: 523 K; 80 atm; Cu/ZnO/Al2O3
reactions.description: Industrial methanol synthesis from syngas. ~100 million tonnes/year globally.

reactions.name: Ethylene production (steam cracking)
reactions.conditions: 1123 K; steam cracking; residence time <1 second
reactions.description: Thermal dehydrogenation of ethane to ethylene. Largest-volume petrochemical.

reactions.name: Polyethylene polymerization
reactions.conditions: Ziegler-Natta (TiCl4/AlEt3) or metallocene; various pressures by process type
reactions.description: Polymerization of ethylene to polyethylene. Most-produced plastic globally.

reactions.name: Catalytic cracking (general)
reactions.conditions: 773 K; zeolite (USY or ZSM-5); FCC unit; 2-5 second contact time
reactions.description: Fluid catalytic cracking (FCC) of heavy petroleum fractions into gasoline.

reactions.name: Methane combustion
reactions.conditions: ignition source required
reactions.description: Natural gas combustion. Cleanest-burning fossil fuel.

reactions.name: Cement clinker formation (limestone calcination)
reactions.conditions: 1173 K; rotary kiln
reactions.description: Calcination of limestone. Major source of industrial CO2 emissions.

reactions.name: PVC production (vinyl chloride)
reactions.conditions: FeCl3
reactions.description: Direct chlorination of ethylene to 1,2-dichloroethane (EDC). Precursor to PVC.

reactions.name: Blast furnace iron smelting (overall)
reactions.conditions: 1773 K; blast furnace with coke as reductant
reactions.description: Primary iron ore reduction. CO generated in situ from coke + hot air.

reactions.name: Coke combustion in blast furnace
reactions.conditions: 1773 K; blast furnace tuyere zone
reactions.description: Limited combustion of coke produces CO reductant gas in blast furnace.

reactions.name: Basic oxygen steelmaking
reactions.conditions: 1923 K; pure O2 blown into molten pig iron; removes excess C as CO
reactions.description: Basic oxygen furnace (BOF) converts pig iron to steel by blowing O2. ~70% of world steel.

reactions.name: Steam methane reforming
reactions.conditions: 1100 K; 20 atm; nickel on alumina
reactions.description: Primary industrial hydrogen production method. Produces syngas.

reactions.name: Water-gas shift reaction
reactions.conditions: 623 K; iron oxide (HTS) or Cu-ZnO-Al2O3 (LTS)
reactions.description: Converts CO and steam to CO2 and H2. Used after steam reforming.

reactions.name: Lithium carbonate to lithium metal
reactions.description: Thermal decomposition of lithium carbonate. Precursor to lithium metal electrolysis.

reactions.name: Manganese dioxide reduction (ferromanganese)
reactions.conditions: 1573 K; electric arc furnace for ferromanganese
reactions.description: Carbothermic reduction of pyrolusite. 90% of Mn used in steel production.

reactions.name: Urea synthesis
reactions.conditions: 458 K; 175 atm; two-step via ammonium carbamate
reactions.description: Bosch-Meiser process. World's most-produced chemical by mass (~180 Mt/y). Fertilizer.

reactions.name: Solvay process (overall)
reactions.conditions: multi-step process using NH3 as intermediate
reactions.description: Overall Solvay process for soda ash (Na2CO3). Key step involves NaHCO3 precipitation.

reactions.name: Solvay process (key precipitation step)
reactions.equation: NaCl(aq) + NH3(aq) + CO2(g) + H2O(l) -> NaHCO3(s) + NH4Cl(aq)
reactions.conditions: 288 K; CO2 bubbled through ammoniacal brine
reactions.description: NaHCO3 precipitates due to low solubility. Filtered and calcined to Na2CO3.

reactions.name: Sodium hydroxide + CO2 (caustic scrubbing)
reactions.description: Caustic scrubbing of CO2 from flue gas or process streams.

reactions.name: Mond process (nickel purification)
reactions.conditions: 323 K; Ni(CO)4 decomposes at 230C to deposit pure Ni; extremely toxic gas
reactions.description: Mond process: volatile Ni(CO)4 formed at 50C, decomposed at 230C for 99.99% pure Ni.

reactions.name: Phosphorus production (electric arc furnace)
reactions.equation: 2 Ca3(PO4)2(s) + 6 SiO2(s) + 10 C(s) -> P4(g) + 6 CaSiO3(l) + 10 CO(g)
reactions.conditions: 1773 K; electric arc furnace; P4 vapor condensed under water
reactions.description: White phosphorus production from phosphate rock via electric arc furnace.

reactions.name: Soda-lime glass production
reactions.conditions: 1773 K; glass furnace
reactions.description: Sodium carbonate lowers melting point of silica in glass manufacture.

reactions.name: Silicon production (carbothermic reduction)
reactions.conditions: 2173 K; electric arc furnace
reactions.description: Metallurgical-grade silicon production. Purified further for semiconductor use.

reactions.name: Tin smelting
reactions.conditions: 1473 K; reverberatory furnace; one of the oldest smelting processes
reactions.description: Carbothermic reduction of cassiterite. Bronze Age technology. Tin used in solder and tinplate.

reactions.name: Kroll process step 1 (chlorination)
reactions.description: Rutile ore converted to titanium tetrachloride. First step of Kroll process.

reactions.name: Zinc smelting (carbothermic reduction)
reactions.conditions: 1373 K; Imperial Smelting Process or retort
reactions.description: Carbothermic reduction of ZnO. Zinc vapor condensed and collected.

reactions.name: Bromine water test for unsaturation
reactions.description: Decolorization of bromine water indicates C=C double bond. Classic qualitative test.

reactions.name: CO2 generation (marble + HCl)
reactions.description: Reaction of marble chips (CaCO3) with hydrochloric acid. Common CO2 source in lab.

reactions.name: Fischer esterification
reactions.conditions: concentrated H2SO4; reflux; equilibrium reaction
reactions.description: Acid-catalyzed esterification. Ethyl acetate has fruity smell. Common teaching reaction.

reactions.name: Saponification (ester hydrolysis)
reactions.conditions: heating; irreversible (OH- drives to completion)
reactions.description: Base hydrolysis of an ester. Called saponification when applied to fats (soap making).

reactions.name: Grignard reaction (general)
reactions.conditions: anhydrous diethyl ether; strictly dry glassware; N2 atmosphere
reactions.description: Grignard reagent adds to carbonyl. Produces secondary alcohol from aldehyde. Nobel Prize 1912.

reactions.name: Aldol condensation
reactions.conditions: NaOH (dilute); low temperature favors aldol; heat gives crotonaldehyde
reactions.description: Aldol addition forms beta-hydroxy aldehyde. Cornerstone of organic synthesis.

reactions.name: Cannizzaro reaction (benzaldehyde)
reactions.conditions: concentrated NaOH; aldehydes without alpha-H
reactions.description: Non-enolizable aldehyde disproportionation to acid + alcohol. Named for Stanislao Cannizzaro.

reactions.name: Tollens' test (silver mirror)
reactions.equation: RCHO(aq) + 2 [Ag(NH3)2]+(aq) + 2 OH-(aq) -> RCOO-(aq) + 2 Ag(s) + 4 NH3(aq) + H2O(l)
reactions.conditions: warm gently; silver deposits as mirror on clean glass
reactions.description: Silver mirror test distinguishes aldehydes from ketones. Ag+ reduced to metallic silver.

reactions.name: Fehling's test (reducing sugars)
reactions.equation: RCHO(aq) + 2 Cu2+(aq) + 5 OH-(aq) -> RCOO-(aq) + Cu2O(s) + 3 H2O(l)
reactions.conditions: heat to boiling; blue Cu2+ to brick-red Cu2O precipitate
reactions.description: Brick-red Cu2O precipitate indicates reducing sugar or aldehyde. Blue to red color change.

reactions.name: Calcium carbonate precipitation
reactions.description: White precipitate of calcium carbonate. Dissolves in dilute acid with effervescence.

reactions.name: Iron(III) thiocyanate test
reactions.description: Blood-red color confirms Fe3+ ions. Very sensitive test. Used in equilibrium demonstrations.

reactions.name: Prussian blue formation
reactions.description: Prussian blue: intense blue pigment. Historic iron detection test. Also used in art.

reactions.name: Acetic acid + NaOH (weak acid titration)
reactions.conditions: phenolphthalein indicator; endpoint pH ~8.7
reactions.description: Weak acid-strong base titration. Equivalence point is basic due to conjugate base hydrolysis.

reactions.name: Barking dog reaction
reactions.conditions: ignite CS2/N2O mixture in long tube; blue flame + barking sound
reactions.description: CS2 vapor and N2O combust with distinctive barking sound and blue flash. Popular demonstration.

reactions.name: Magnesium in dry ice
reactions.conditions: Mg ribbon burns inside CO2; demonstrates that CO2 fire extinguisher fails for Mg fires
reactions.description: Magnesium burns in CO2, reducing it to carbon. Demonstrates that CO2 extinguishers are useless for metal fires.

reactions.name: Briggs-Rauscher oscillating reaction
reactions.equation: IO3-(aq) + 2 H2O2(aq) + CH2(COOH)2(aq) + H+(aq) -> ICH(COOH)2(aq) + 2 O2(g) + 3 H2O(l)
reactions.conditions: MnSO4; oscillates amber -> blue -> colorless for ~10 cycles
reactions.description: Chemical oscillator. Color cycles amber -> blue -> colorless repeatedly. Non-equilibrium thermodynamics.
